tool.name: Circos
tool.description: builds plots from standard bioinformatics datatypes
tool.command:
## Directory structure mkdir -p circos/conf/ circos/data/ &&
#if $reference_genome.ref.ref_source == 'history': ln -s '$reference_genome.ref.genome_fasta' genomeref.fa && #end if
#if $reference_genome.ref.ref_source in ('lengths', 'cached'): python '$__tool_directory__/genome-lengths-to-karyotype.py' #if $reference_genome.ref.ref_source == 'lengths': ${reference_genome.ref.input_lengths}' #else '${reference_genome.ref.fasta_indexes.fields.len_path}' #end if '${reference_genome.ref.color}' > circos/conf/karyotype.txt && #else if $reference_genome.ref.ref_source == 'karyotype': cp $reference_genome.ref.input_karyotype circos/conf/karyotype.txt && #else if str($reference_genome.ref.ref_source) == 'history': ## Process the karyotype.txt file python '$__tool_directory__/fasta-to-karyotype.py' genomeref.fa '${reference_genome.ref.color}'
> circos/conf/karyotype.txt && #end if
touch circos/conf/karyotype-colors.conf && #if $reference_genome.bands: #if $reference_genome.convert_bands: python '$__tool_directory__/process-cytogenetic-bands.py' '${reference_genome.bands}' >> circos/conf/karyotype.txt 2> circos/conf/karyotype-colors.conf && #else cat '${reference_genome.bands}' >> circos/conf/karyotype.txt && #end if #end if
#if $plot_options.colour_profile: #if str($plot_options.colour_profile) == 'cg': cat '$__tool_directory__/colours/cg.conf' >> circos/conf/karyotype-colors.conf && #end if #end if
mv '$circos_conf' circos/conf/circos.conf && mv '$ticks_conf' circos/conf/ticks.conf && mv '$ideogram_conf' circos/conf/ideogram.conf && mv '$data_conf' circos/conf/data.conf && mv '$highlight_conf' circos/conf/highlight.conf && mv '$links_conf' circos/conf/links.conf && mv '$test_case_conf' circos/conf/galaxy_test_case.xml &&
## Highlights #for $hi, $data in enumerate($sec_highlight.data): cp '${data.data_source}' circos/data/highlight-${hi}.txt && #end for
## 2D Data Plots #for $hi, $data in enumerate($sec_tdd.data): cp '${data.plot_format.data_source}' circos/data/data-${hi}.txt && #end for
## Link Tracks #for $hi, $data in enumerate($sec_links.data): cp '${data.data_source}' circos/data/links-${hi}.txt && #end for
#if $outputs.tar == "yes" tar cvfz circos.tar.gz circos >/dev/null #else echo '' #end if
#if $outputs.svg == "yes" or $outputs.png == "yes": && circos -conf circos/conf/circos.conf -noparanoid #end if

param.name: fasta_indexes
param.label: Source Genome Build
param.help: **WARNING WARNING WARNING**: this option will PROBABLY NOT WORK for you! Many of the length files in Galaxy have many small sequences that are cytologically unplaced but important for analyses. These are usually uninteresting in visualisation and these exceed Circos' limit on the number of ideograms to plot and we could not find an acceptable solution that was general enough. If you use this and Circos crashes, then please specify the precise list of contig names that you want to plot in the 'Limit/Filter Chromosomes' section. Alternatively, as there is currently no other way, the Galaxy Circos tool suite includes a tool to extract the chromosome lengths for your genome of interest, and then you can filter them yourselves, and provide it in the 'Lengths File' option above. Sorry there is currently no better option, we explored 8 different ones before giving up.

param.name: input_karyotype
param.label: Karyotype Configuration
param.help: Provide your own karyotype configuration. Should be 'chr - ID LABEL START END COLOR'

param.name: input_lengths
param.label: Sequence Lengths
param.help: This needs to be a 2+ column tabular, e.g. from 'Compute sequence lengths', the first column should be chromosome and second should be length.

param.name: limit_chromosomes
param.label: Limit/Filter Chromosomes
param.help: Syntax is: 'hs1;hs2;hs3' (-hs1 syntax is not currently supported.) You can additionally select a subset of a chromosome with the syntax: 'hs1:1-1000;hs2:3000-9000'

param.name: chromosomes_reverse
param.label: Reverse these Chromosomes
param.help: Important: If you set this, you will need to set the limit_chromosomes option as well. Syntax is: hs1,hs2

param.name: bands
param.label: Cytogenetic Bands
param.help: If defined, will display cytogenetic bands as part of the karyotype configuration. This field accepts any tabular format file. If you provide a BED file you should enable automatic conversion below. Otherwise disable conversion below and it is expected that your file have 7 columns: 'band', chromosome ID (should match fasta), band ID, band ID (again), start, end, color (gneg, gpos, or r,g,b triple). E.g. a complete row would look like: 'band chr1 p32.2 p32.2 56100000 59000000 gneg25'

param.name: convert_bands
param.label: Convert bands from BED format to circos karyotype band format
param.help: Automatically reformat BED file into the appropriate columns. This should be a BED 6+ file, BED 9+ if you want the colours from the BED file automatically used. Otherwise everything will appear grey.

param.name: radius
param.label: Image Radius
param.help: Plot radius, final plot dimensions will be 2*r by 2*r

param.name: colour_profile
param.label: Load additional colour profiles
param.help: Only useful in a tiny subset of situations

param.name: units
param.label: Chromosome units
param.help: Setting this to MB allows usage of numbers like 5u to represent 5MB, rather than having to specify 5000000 or 5e6

param.name: parallel
param.label: Parallel
param.help: When set to yes/true, labels will be perpendicular to the tangent of the circle at the location of the label. Otherwise, they will be parallel with the tangent of the circle

param.name: band_transparency
param.label: Fill Bands
param.help: 0 is solid, 1 is the least transparent, and 5 is the most transparent

param.name: spacing
param.label: Tick Spacing
param.help: Number of bases (number + u syntax works)

param.name: format_ext
param.label: Show unit in tick labels
param.help: If your chromosome units is set to kilobases and you have enabled this option and enabled tick labels, they will include the size value, e.g. '500 kb'

param.name: orientation
param.label: Orient Inwards
param.help: When yes/true, the plot will face inwards. I.e. lowest values will be to the outside

param.name: data_source
param.label: Histogram Data Source
param.help: Columns must be (chrom, start, end, score)

param.name: extend_bins
param.label: Join non-abutting Bins
param.help: Join histogram bins that do not touch (abut)

param.name: data_source
param.label: Histogram Data Source
param.help: Columns must be (chrom, start, end, score)

param.name: extend_bins
param.label: Join non-abutting Bins
param.help: Join histogram bins that do not touch (abut)

param.name: scale_log_base
param.label: Scale Log Base
param.help: If scale_log_base<1, the dynamic range of color mapping of small values will be increased. If scale_log_base>1, then dynamic range of large values will be increased.

param.name: data_source
param.label: Tile Data Source
param.help: If your tile source features have scores in them, they will be used in colouration

param.name: thickness
param.label: Thickness
param.help: In pixels

param.name: padding
param.label: Padding
param.help: In pixels

param.name: margin
param.label: Margin
param.help: In chromosome units. This is essentially distance added to the gene, before laying it out. Increasing it will prevent genes from packing as well.

param.name: overflow_behavior
param.label: Overflow Behavior
param.option: Hide: overflow tiles are not drawn
Grow: new layers are added as required
Collapse: overflow tiles are drawn on the first layer

param.name: link_thickness
param.label: Link thickness
param.help: In pixels

param.name: label_snuggle
param.label: Snuggle Labels
param.help: The label's radial position may be slightly adjusted to reduce the number of layers of text

param.name: max_snuggle_distance
param.label: Max snuggle Distance
param.help: Shift label up to N times its height, in the angular direction

param.name: snuggle_sampling
param.label: Snuggle Sampling
param.help: Sample possible positions every N pixels

param.name: snuggle_tolerance
param.label: Snuggle Tolerance
param.help: You can also short-circuit precise placement by setting snuggle_tolerance (absolute or relative to label's tangential size). The larger this value, the less precise the placement. (from Circos manual)

param.name: snuggle_link_overlap_test
param.label: Snuggle Link Overlap Test
param.help: If the labels have a link line, you choose to test whether link lines overlap with previous labels using snuggle_link_overlap_test (from Circos manual)

param.name: snuggle_link_overlap_tolerance
param.label: Snuggle Link Overlap Tolerance
param.help: The extent of acceptable overlap is set using snuggle_link_overlap_tolerance (from Circos manual)

param.name: snuggle_refine
param.label: Snuggle refine
param.help: The snuggle_refine parameter toggles an additional check for crossing of links of labels that are placed at similar radial positions. Label pairs whose link lines cross are swapped. This refine parameter is functionaly only if show_links=yes. (from Circos manual)

param.name: radius
param.label: Inside Radius
param.help: This is the radial position of the termination of the link; for relative values, if radius smaller than 1 then it is defined in terms of the inner ideogram radius, otherwise it is defined in terms of the outer ideogram radius

param.name: data_source
param.label: Link Data Source
param.help: Select file with link data. Format: chr1 start1 end1 chr2 start2 end2

param.name: thickness
param.label: Thickness
param.help: In pixels

param.name: bezier_radius
param.label: Bezier Radius
param.help: The radial position of the third control point (in addition to the two positions defined by the link coordinates) used to draw the Bezier curve; if this parameter is 0 then straight lines will be used

param.name: zdepth
param.label: Z-depth
param.help: Optional. Datasets with a higher z-depth value are drawn on top of data sets with a lower value. Only useful if plotting multiple link tracks

param.name: crest
param.label: Crest
param.help: Two additional Bezier control points can be set by using the crest parameter. When defined, points p3 and p4 are added. These points lie at the same angular position as the start and end link termini and have the radial position. In the crest=0 extreme, p3 and p4 are at the same position as p0,p1. In this case, crest has no effect. When crest=1, p3,p4 are at the radial position of p2, the control point set by bezier_radius

param.name: bezier_radius_purity
param.label: Bezier Radius Purity
param.help: The bezier_radius_purity adjusts the position of p2 for each link. The p2 control point will move along the line formed by the original p2 location and the intersection of p0-p1 and the bisecting radius. When purity = 1, p2' = p2. When purity = 0, p2' = midpoint(p0,p1)

param.name: perturb
param.label: Perturb links?
param.help: A set of parameters can be used to randomly adjust bezier_radius, bezier_radius_purity, and crest parameters to give the links a more disorganized, organic feel. By perturbing each link you can also show additional texture in the data among links which would have ordinarily overlapped. Each parameter's perturbation amount is defined as a pair of values - pmin,pmax. These are the minimum and maximum multipliers by which the value can be perturbed

param.name: perturb_crest_min
param.label: Crest min
param.help: For example setting (min,max) = (0.5,1.2) will cause parameter to be randomly scaled between 50-120%

param.name: perturb_crest_max
param.label: Crest max
param.help: For example setting (min,max) = (0.5,1.2) will cause parameter to be randomly scaled between 50-120%

param.name: perturb_bezier_radius_min
param.label: Bezier Radius min
param.help: For example setting (min,max) = (0.5,1.2) will cause parameter to be randomly scaled between 50-120%

param.name: perturb_bezier_radius_max
param.label: Bezier Radius max
param.help: For example setting (min,max) = (0.5,1.2) will cause parameter to be randomly scaled between 50-120%

param.name: perturb_bezier_radius_purity_min
param.label: Bezier Radius Purity min
param.help: For example setting (min,max) = (0.5,1.2) will cause parameter to be randomly scaled between 50-120%

param.name: perturb_bezier_radius_purity_max
param.label: Bezier Radius Purity max
param.help: For example setting (min,max) = (0.5,1.2) will cause parameter to be randomly scaled between 50-120%

tool.help:
Circos ======
Circos is a software package for visualizing data and information. It visualizes data in a circular layout â€” this makes Circos ideal for exploring relationships between objects or positions. There are other reasons why a circular layout is advantageous, not the least being the fact that it is attractive.
Circos is ideal for creating publication-quality infographics and illustrations with a high data-to-ink ratio, richly layered data and pleasant symmetries. You have fine control each element in the figure to tailor its focus points and detail to your audience.
.. image:: $PATH_TO_IMAGES/circos-sample-panel.png :alt: several example circos plots
For more information see the Circos documentation_.
.. _documentation: http://circos.ca/documentation/
